title: 'Memory of Princess Mumbi' Director Damien Hauser on AI, African Film
description: Set in a retro-futuristic Africa, the film utilizes AI to craft a clever, bittersweet meta-fiction about art, memory and artificial intelligence.
content:
If AI is coming for filmmakers, don’t tell that to director Damien Hauser.
In his latest feature, “Memory of Princess Mumbi,” which premieres in the Venice Days sidebar of the Venice Film Festival, the young Swiss Kenyan filmmaker imagines a retro-fu... [4040 chars]

title: ‘I have reduced staff from 9,000 to 5,000 because…’: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff justifies why his company cut 4,000 jobs
description: Salesforce has laid off 4,000 customer support employees as artificial intelligence takes on a growing share of its service operations.
content: Artificial Intelligence strikes again! Yep you heard that right AI has now led to layoffs in yet another company. Tech Industry is reeling from mass layoffs after layoffs as AI is increasingly being used by companies to automate jobs. Salesforce has ... [2524 chars]

title: Latam-GPT: The Free, Open Source, and Collaborative AI of Latin America
description: WIRED talks to the director of the Chilean National Center for Artificial Intelligence about Latam-GPT, the large-language model that aims to address the region’s specific needs and change the current technological dynamic.
content: The supercomputing infrastructure at the University of Tarapacá (UTA) in Arica, Chile, is a fundamental pillar for Latam-GPT. With a projected investment of $10 million, the new center has a cluster of 12 nodes, each equipped with eight state-of-the-... [3004 chars]

title: Siddharth Pai: OpenAI’s India launch will steepen its learning curve
description: ChatGPT’s low-cost service here gives it a vast test market of diverse and argumentative chatbot users. For the evolution of artificial intelligence (AI), the gains from such mass interactivity are worth more to its developer OpenAI than the revenues raised.

title: Data Centers That Don’t Exist Yet Are Already Haunting the Grid
description: Utilities see a massive opportunity in artificial intelligence but realize that many proposed data-center projects will never be built. | World News
content:
Data centers are desperate to connect to the U.S. electric grid. What remains fuzzy is how many will ultimately be built and how much electricity they will require.
